alert.note: Alert for Bland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 8:42AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and southeast West Virginia, including the following counties, in southwest Virginia, Bland, Giles and Tazewell. In southeast West Virginia, Mercer. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 842 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.0 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Dry Fork, Dismal Creek, Crab Orchard Creek, Bratton Branch, Big Spring Branch, Bluestone River, East River and East Fork Cove Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bluefield... Bastian... Rocky Gap... Pocahontas... Bramwell... Clear Fork... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
